alert.note: Alert for Benton; Iowa; Johnson; Keokuk; Linn; Louisa; Muscatine; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 5:26AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Louisa, northeastern Keokuk, Johnson, southern Benton, northern Washington, southwestern Muscatine, southwestern Linn and Iowa Counties through 615 AM CDT... At 526 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles northwest of Keystone to near North English. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cedar Rapids, Iowa City, Marengo, Marion, Coralville, North Liberty, Hiawatha, Robins, Williamsburg, Belle Plaine, Kalona, Fairfax, Tiffin, Ely, Atkins, Walford, Wellman, Lone Tree, University Heights and North English. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 206 and 248. Interstate 380 between mile markers 1 and 31. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Benton; Iowa; Johnson; Keokuk; Linn; Louisa; Muscatine; Washington
